Cambodian Committee for Remembering Kim Il Sung Inaugurated
articles.content:
Cambodian Committee for Remembering Kim Il Sung Inaugurated 
   Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- The Cambodian Committee for Remembering the Great Leader Generalissimo Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on June 12.
 At its inaugural ceremony Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, was elected chairman of the committee.    
 The committee decided to organize colorful political functions on the occasion of the 12th anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung and widely introduce his immortal exploits in the cause of global independence and the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.

Institution of "Day Commemorating Publication of June 15 Joint Declaration" Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Institution of "Day Commemorating Publication of June 15 Joint Declaration" Called for in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea reportedly made public a statement on June 13 in which it clarified its stand to make positive efforts to implement the June 15 joint declaration, which contains the valuable promise made by the nation, with a view to frustrating the moves of the conservatives to bring the inter-Korean ties back to those before the publication of the joint declaration.
 In the meantime, a lawmaker from the party, when interviewed by reporters in the building of the "National Assembly" on June 14, called for positively discussing the issue of instituting June 15 as a commemoration day, prompted by the commitment to implement the tasks in the present times, ie peace and reunification and the joint declaration.

Book "Indomitable Revolutionary Fighter Comrade Kim Chol Ju" Sees Light
articles.content:
Book "Indomitable Revolutionary Fighter Comrade  Kim Chol Ju" Sees Light 
   Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Book "Indomitable Revolutionary Fighter Comrade Kim Chol Ju" has been brought out by the Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House.
 It has six chapters, which deals in detail with the revolutionary life and exploits of Kim Chol Ju, an indomitable revolutionary fighter. He devoted his whole life to the sacred war for national liberation with revolutionary enthusiasm, fulfilling his heavy responsibilities as chief for information of the Saenal Children's Union, secretary of the young communist league in Xiaoshahegou and chief for operation inside the anti-Japanese unit in Antu after embarking upon the road of revolutionary struggle in his teens.    
 Kim Chol Ju died a heroic death in a fierce battle with the enemy near Chechangzi on June 14, Juche 24 (1935), the book says, adding that short as his life was, it was a noble life characterized by ardent love for the country and the people, intense loyalty to the revolutionary cause, the indomitable will to annihilate the enemy and revolutionary optimism.

Greetings to Seychellois President
articles.content:
Greetings to Seychellois President
   Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Seychellois President James Alix Michel on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished the Seychellois president and people greater success in their work for prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop in mutual interests.

articles.title: Congratulations to British Queen
articles.content:
Congratulations to British Queen
   Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Elizabeth II, Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
 The message wished the Queen good health and happiness, extending warm congratulations to her on her birthday, the official national day.

articles.title: Greetings to Hungarian PM and FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Hungarian PM and FM
   Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a congratulatory message to Gyurcsany Ferenc upon his reappointment as prime minister of Hungary.
 Expressing the belief that the cooperative relations between Korea and Hungary would continue to develop in mutual interests in the future, too, the message wished the prime minister new success in his work for prosperity of the country and well-being of the people.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar massage to Goncz Kinga upon her appointment as foreign minister of Hungary.
